sen.j: 藤原 家通（ふじわら の いえみち、天喜4年（1056年） - 永久 (日本)4年1月25日 (旧暦)（1116年2月10日））は、平安時代後期の貴族。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Iemichi (1156 - February 10, 1116) was a nobleman in the late Heian period.
FUJIWARA no Iemichi (1156 - February 10, 1116) was a nobleman during the late Heian period.
FUJIWARA no Iemichi (1156 - February 17, 1116) was a nobleman during the late Heian period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に直しました。

sen.e: He was a son of FUJIWARA no Akitsuna.
He was the son of FUJIWARA no Akitsuna.
He was the son of FUJIWARA no Akitsuna.
His mother was a daughter of FUJIWARA no Takatsune.
His mother was the daughter of FUJIWARA no Takatsune.
His mother was the daughter of FUJIWARA no Takatsune.

sen.j: 「家道」とも表記した他、一時長真と名乗るが勅命によって旧名に戻されたという。
sen.e: His name was spelled '家道' as well as '家通', and also temporarily called himself 'Choshin', but they say he received an imperial order and made to return to the old name.
His name was spelled '家道' as well as '家通', and he also temporarily called himself 'Choshin,' but they say he received an imperial order and forced to return to his old name.
His name was written as '家道' as well as '家通', and he also temporarily called himself Choshin, but they say he received an imperial order and forced to return to his old name.

sen.j: 兄弟に藤原有佐・藤原長子ら。
sen.e: His brothers included FUJIWARA no Arisuke and FUJIWARA no Nagako.
His brothers included FUJIWARA no Arisuke and FUJIWARA no Nagako.
His siblings included FUJIWARA no Arisuke and FUJIWARA no Nagako.

sen.j: 子に藤原顕経・源豪・恵暁ら。
sen.e: His children included FUJIWARA no Akitsune, Gengo, and Keikyo.
His children included FUJIWARA no Akitsune, Gengo, and Keikyo.
His children included FUJIWARA no Akitsune, Gengo, and Keikyo.

sen.j: 承暦2年（1078年）の内裏歌合の右方に越前守として出席して勝利。
sen.e: He joined the to the right side of Dairi Utaawase (the palace poetry contest) as Echizen no kuni kokushi (the provincial governor of Ecchu Province) in 1078 and won.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He joined the right side of Dairi Utaawase (the palace poetry contest) as Echizen no kuni kokushi (the provincial governor of Ecchu Province) in 1078 and won.
He joined the right side of Dairi Utaawase (the palace poetry contest) as Echizen no kami (Governor of Echizen Province) in 1078 and won.
sen.cmt: リンク文字列が含まれていたので、原文・訳文共に修正しました。

sen.j: 翌承暦3年（1077年）に昇殿が許され、程なく侍従となる。
sen.e: He was permitted access to the imperial court in 1077 and soon became jiju (a chamberlain).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was permitted access to the imperial court in 1077 and soon became jiju (chamberlain).
He was permitted access to the Imperial Court in 1077 and soon became jiju (chamberlain).

sen.j: 左近衛少将・左京権大夫・加賀守などを歴任後正四位下宮内卿に至る。
sen.e: He successively worked as Sakone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), Sakyo no gon no daibu (Provisional Master of the Eastern Capital Offices), and Kaga no kuni no kami (officer in charge of regional administration in Kaga) etc. and then became Shoshiinoge kunaikyo (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade and Chief administrator of the imperial household).

He successively worked as Sakone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), Sakyo no gon no daibu (Provisional Master of the Eastern Capital Offices), and Kaga no kuni no kami (officer in charge of regional administration in Kaga) etc. and then became Shoshiinoge kunaikyo (Senior 4th Rank, Lower Grade and Chief administrator of the imperial household).

He successively worked as Sakone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), Sakyo no gon no daibu (Provisional Master of the Eastern Capital Offices), and Kaga no kami (Governor of Kaga Province), and so on, and then became Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Kunaikyo (Minister of the Sovereign's Household).
sen.cmt: リンク文字列が含まれていたので、原文・訳文共に修正しました。

sen.j: また、禎子内親王及びその孫（養女）・篤子内親王家の別当を務めた（禎子内親王の乳母弁乳母は家通の父方の祖母）。
sen.e: In addition, he served as betto (steward) of Imperial Princess Teishi and the family of her (adopted) grandchild Imperial Princess Tokushi (Imperial Princess Teishi's menoto (a woman providing breast-feed to a highborn baby) and Ben no Menoto (nurse of Imperial Princess Teishi) was Iemichi's paternal grandmother).

In addition, he served as betto (steward) of Imperial Princess Teishi and the family of her (adopted) grandchild Imperial Princess Tokushi (Imperial Princess Teishi's menoto (a woman providing breast-feeingd to a highborn baby) and Ben no Menoto (nurse of Imperial Princess Teishi) was Iemichi's paternal grandmother).

In addition, he served as betto (steward) of Imperial Princess Teishi and her grandchild (adopted daughter) Imperial Princess Tokushi's family (Ben no Menoto, who was a wet nurse of Imperial Princess Teishi, was Iemichi's paternal grandmother).

sen.j: 没後、その宅地は白河法皇によって買い取られた。
sen.e: After his death, Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa bought his house.
After his death, Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa bought his house.
After his death, Cloistered Emperor Shirakawa bought his house.

sen.j: 後に保元の乱の激戦地となる三条東殿が造営されることとなる。
sen.e: Later, Sanjo Higashidono was build there, which became a bloodiest battlefield in the Hogen War.
Later, Sanjo Higashidono was build there, which became the bloodiest battlefield in the Hogen War.
Later, Sanjo Higashidono was build there, which became the bloodiest battlefield in the Hogen War.
